name: Réunion
description: Réunion is a French overseas department located in the Indian Ocean, renowned for its dramatic volcanic landscapes, lush rainforests, and diverse ecosystems.  It’s a haven for biodiversity, boasting unique flora and fauna found nowhere else on Earth.  The island’s varied terrain, from towering peaks to pristine beaches, offers a wealth of outdoor activities and a captivating blend of French and Creole culture.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city of Réunion.
quickFacts.detail: Saint-Denis is the economic and administrative center of the island, offering a vibrant mix of markets, shops, and cultural attractions.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: The population is a blend of French, Creole, and Sino-Reunionese communities.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The total land area of Réunion.
quickFacts.detail: It’s roughly the size of Singapore.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: As part of France, Réunion uses the Euro.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken on the island.
quickFacts.detail: Creole is also widely spoken and understood.

quickFacts.label: Elevation
quickFacts.detail: Piton des Neiges is the highest peak.

climateData.title: Climate of Réunion
climateData.description: Réunion enjoys a tropical maritime climate, characterized by warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is abundant, particularly during the wet season. The mountainous interior experiences cooler temperatures and increased precipitation.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is the wettest season, with frequent showers and thunderstorms. Temperatures average around 28°C (82°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a gradual decrease in rainfall and temperatures. It’s a pleasant time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the driest season, with sunny days and cooler temperatures. Temperatures average around 24°C (75°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring sees a gradual increase in rainfall and temperatures, returning to the conditions of summer.

naturalWonders.name: Piton des Neiges
naturalWonders.description: Piton des Neiges is Réunion’s highest peak, a dormant volcano offering breathtaking panoramic views. Its slopes are covered in unique alpine vegetation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The peak is accessible via challenging hikes, rewarding climbers with stunning vistas of the island. The surrounding area is a haven for endemic plant and animal species.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before setting out
Hire a local guide for challenging routes

naturalWonders.name: Cirque de Salazie
naturalWonders.description: Cirque de Salazie is a stunning volcanic crater filled with lush vegetation, cascading waterfalls, and traditional Creole villages.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The crater is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, renowned for its unique microclimate and biodiversity. The villages are characterized by their colorful houses and traditional architecture.
viewingTips: Drive carefully on the winding roads
Explore the villages and sample local cuisine

naturalWonders.name: Mafate
naturalWonders.description: Mafate is a remote and isolated valley, accessible only by foot or helicopter, known for its dramatic landscapes and unique flora and fauna.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The valley is characterized by its steep cliffs, dense rainforests, and numerous waterfalls. It’s a paradise for hikers and nature lovers.

ecosystemData.title: Réunion’s Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Réunion’s ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from volcanic peaks and rainforests to coral reefs and coastal wetlands. The island’s isolation has fostered a high degree of endemism, with many species found nowhere else on Earth.

biodiversityCategories.name: Endemic Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: Réunion is home to a significant number of endemic plant species, adapted to the island’s unique environment.

statistics.details: Many species of Lauraceae and Ebenaceae are endemic.
A diverse range of orchid species thrive in the rainforests.

notableSpecies.name: Codiaea lunulata
notableSpecies.significance: A rare succulent plant found only in the high mountains.

notableSpecies.name: Syringodium casanum
notableSpecies.significance: A unique palm species adapted to wet conditions.

biodiversityCategories.name: Endemic Fauna
biodiversityCategories.description: Réunion’s fauna is equally remarkable, with many endemic bird, reptile, and insect species.

statistics.details: Several species of honeycreepers and warblers are found only on Réunion.
Unique gecko and skink species inhabit the island.

notableSpecies.name: Ramezay’s Weaver
notableSpecies.significance: A distinctive weaver bird found only in the rainforests.

notableSpecies.name: Réunion Colette
notableSpecies.significance: A unique gecko species adapted to the volcanic landscape.

activities.title: Activities in Réunion
activities.description: Réunion offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from challenging hikes to relaxing beach days.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Réunion is a hiker’s paradise, with trails ranging from easy coastal walks to challenging climbs of volcanic peaks.

activities.name: Piton des Neiges Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Réunion’s highest peak.
activities.requirements: Good fitness level, hiking boots, waterproof clothing

activities.name: Cirque de Mafate Loop
activities.description: A multi-day trek through the remote and stunning Cirque de Mafate.
activities.requirements: Excellent fitness level, navigation skills, camping equipment

activityCategories.name: Water Sports

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Several beaches offer good surfing conditions.

activities.name: Snorkeling & Diving
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.
